sen.j: 細川 満元（ほそかわ みつもと、天授 (日本)4年/永和 (日本)4年（1378年）- 応永33年10月16日 (旧暦)（1426年11月15日））は、室町時代前期の管領。
sen.e: Mitsumoto HOSOKAWA (1378 - November 15, 1425) is a kanrei (shogunal deputy) in the early Muromachi period.
Mitsumoto HOSOKAWA (1378 - November 15, 1425) was a Kanrei (shogunal deputy) lived in the early Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 動詞を過去形に変更し，livedを補いました。役職名を大文字にしました。
sen.e: Mitsumoto HOSOKAWA (1378 - November 15, 1425) was a Kanrei (shogunal deputy) lived in the early Muromachi period.
Shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords)
He was a Shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords).
sen.cmt: 文が不完全です。さらに冠詞を補いました。
sen.e: He was a Shugo daimyo (shugo, which were Japanese provincial military governors, that became daimyo, which were Japanese feudal lords).
Son of Yorimoto HOSOKAWA
He was the son of Yorimoto HOSOKAWA.
He was the son of Yorimoto HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: 官位は右馬頭、右京大夫。
sen.e: His official court rank was Uma no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses) and Ukyo no daibu (Master of the Western Capital Offices).
His official court rank was Uma no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses) and Ukyo no daibu (Master of the Western Capital Offices).
His official court rank was Uma no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses) and Ukyo no daibu (Master of the Western Capital Offices).

sen.j: 子に細川持元、細川持之、細川持賢（典厩家の祖）らがいる。
sen.e: His sons include Mochimoto HOSOKAWA, Mochiyuki HOSOKAWA and Mochikata HOSOKAWA (ancestor of the Tenkyu family).
His sons include Mochimoto HOSOKAWA, Mochiyuki HOSOKAWA and Mochikata HOSOKAWA (the founder of the Tenkyu family).
sen.cmt: 祖は開祖社を意味すると考え訂正しました。
sen.e: His sons include Mochimoto HOSOKAWA, Mochiyuki HOSOKAWA and Mochikata HOSOKAWA (the founder of the Tenkyu family).
His childhood name was Someimaru.
His childhood name was Someimaru.
His childhood name was Someimaru.
His common name was Goro.
His common name was Goro.
His common name was Goro.

sen.j: 1397年、父の死去により家督を継いで土佐国・丹波国・讃岐国・摂津国の守護となる。
sen.e: In 1397, he succeeded his family estate by the death of his father and became Shugo (provincial military governor) in Tosa, Tanba, Sanuki and Settsu Provinces.
On his father's death, he succeeded as the head of the family in 1397 to assume the post of Shugo (provincial military governor) of Tosa, Tanba, Sanuki and Settsu Provinces.
sen.cmt: 文中のby および inを変更し書き換えました。
sen.e: On his father's death, he succeeded as the head of the family in 1397 to assume the post of Shugo (provincial military governor) of Tosa, Tanba, Sanuki and Settsu Provinces.
In March 1412, he became a kanrei.
In March 1412, he was promoted to Kanrei.
sen.cmt: 就任の意味合いを出す必要があると考えました。
sen.e: In March 1412, he was promoted to Kanrei.

sen.j: 就任中の北畠満雅の反乱、上杉禅秀の乱、足利義嗣の殺害事件、有力守護大名と将軍・足利義持との対立など、様々な問題が起こった。
sen.e: Although there were various problems including the rebellion of Mitsumasa KITABATAKE, the war of Zenshu UESUGI, the murder of Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA and the confrontation between major Shugo Daimyo and Shogun Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA during his inauguration, Mitsumoto supported Yoshimochi very much, handled all these problems and worked hard for establishment of Shugo (provincial military governor) combination system.

There were various problems during his term of office, such as the rebellion of Mitsumasa KITABATAKE, the war of Zenshu UESUGI, the murder of Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA and the confrontation between dominant Shugo Guardian Feudal Lord and Shogun Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「就任中」の表現を変えました。
sen.e: There were various problems during his term of office, such as the rebellion of Mitsumasa KITABATAKE, the war of Zenshu UESUGI, the murder of Yoshitsugu ASHIKAGA and the confrontation between dominant Shugo Guardian Feudal Lord and Shogun Yoshimochi ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 満元は義持をよく補佐してこれを全て処理し、守護連合制度の確立に努めた。
sen.e: While supporting Yoshimochi with all his might, Mitsumoto settled all these problems and worked hard for establishing the system of Shugo Allies.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。少々わかりづらいので書き換えました。守護連合制度のイメージがわくように書き換えました。
sen.e: While supporting Yoshimochi with all his might, Mitsumoto settled all these problems and worked hard for establishing the system of Shugo Allies.
In July 1421 he resigned from kanrei (chief adviser).
He resigned from his post of Kanrei in July 1421.
sen.cmt: 少々わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He resigned from his post of Kanrei in July 1421.
On October 16, 1426, he died at the age of 49.
He died on October 16, 1426 at the age of 49.
sen.cmt: 少々わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He died on October 16, 1426 at the age of 49.
